claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.

extracted_evidence.quote: because it is not subject to mutations to the A (H3 N2) glycosylation binding site that reduce the effectiveness of egg based vaccines.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that egg-based vaccines are subject to mutations at a specific site, which can reduce their effectiveness, supporting the claim about mutation risk in production.
